nodes.docs:
Create a loader object that can be directly used as the default export
of a data loader file.
Enables basic storage and retrieval of dates and times.

nodes.text: type Record<K extends keyof any, T> = { [P in K]: T; }
nodes.docs: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

nodes.text:
var Date: DateConstructor
new (value: number | string | Date) => Date (+4 overloads)
(method) Date.toLocaleDateString(locales?: Intl.LocalesArgument, options?: Intl.DateTimeFormatOptions): string (+2 overloads)
nodes.docs: Converts a date to a string by using the current or specified locale.
tags: locales A locale string, array of locale strings, Intl.Locale object, or array of Intl.Locale objects that contain one or more language or locale tags. If you include more than one locale string, list them in descending order of priority so that the first entry is the preferred locale. If you omit this parameter, the default locale of the JavaScript runtime is used.
options An object that contains one or more properties that specify comparison options.

nodes.docs:
Matches a string or an object that supports being matched against, and returns an array
containing the results of that search, or null if no matches are found.
tags: matcher An object that supports being matched against.

nodes.docs: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.

nodes.text:
var Set: SetConstructor
new <string>(iterable?: Iterable<string> | null | undefined) => Set<string> (+1 overload)
(method) String.split(separator: string | RegExp, limit?: number): string[] (+1 overload)
nodes.docs: Split a string into substrings using the specified separator and return them as an array.
tags: separator A string that identifies character or characters to use in separating the string. If omitted, a single-element array containing the entire string is returned.
limit A value used to limit the number of elements returned in the array.

nodes.text: (method) Array<string>.forEach(callbackfn: (value: string, index: number, array: string[]) => void, thisArg?: any): void
nodes.docs: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.
tags: callbackfn A function that accepts up to three arguments. forEach calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

nodes.docs: Appends a new element with a specified value to the end of the Set.

Returns a copy of a section of an array.
For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array.
For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.
tags:
start The beginning index of the specified portion of the array.
If start is undefined, then the slice begins at index 0.

end The end index of the specified portion of the array. This is exclusive of the element at the index 'end'.
If end is undefined, then the slice extends to the end of the array.

nodes.docs: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.
tags: separator A string used to separate one element of the array from the next in the resulting string. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

nodes.docs:
Create a loader object that can be directly used as the default export
of a data loader file.
Include src?

If `boolean`, whether to parse and include excerpt? (rendered as HTML)

If `function`, control how the excerpt is extracted from the content.

If `string`, define a custom separator to be used for extracting the
excerpt. Default separator is `---` if `excerpt` is `true`.
Render src to HTML and include in data?

Transform the data. Note the data will be inlined as JSON in the client
bundle if imported from components or markdown files.
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.
tags: callbackfn A function that accepts up to three arguments. The map method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

nodes.docs:
Sorts an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.
tags:
compareFn Function used to determine the order of the elements. It is expected to return
a negative value if the first argument is less than the second argument, zero if they're equal, and a positive
value otherwise. If omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, UTF-16 code unit order.
```ts
[11,2,22,1].sort((a, b) => a - b)
```

nodes.docs: Returns the stored time value in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
Returns the stored time value in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.

Create a loader object that can be directly used as the default export
of a data loader file.
Include src?

If `boolean`, whether to parse and include excerpt? (rendered as HTML)

If `function`, control how the excerpt is extracted from the content.

If `string`, define a custom separator to be used for extracting the
excerpt. Default separator is `---` if `excerpt` is `true`.
Render src to HTML and include in data?

Transform the data. Note the data will be inlined as JSON in the client
bundle if imported from components or markdown files.
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.
tags: callbackfn A function that accepts up to three arguments. The map method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.
thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

value otherwise. If omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, UTF-16 code unit order.
```ts
[11,2,22,1].sort((a, b) => a - b)
```
